skill.name: gwas-database
skill.description: Query NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog for SNP-trait associations. Search variants by rs ID, disease/trait, gene, retrieve p-values and summary statistics, for genetic epidemiology and polygenic risk scores.
skill.summary: Query NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog for SNP-trait associations. Search variants by rs ID, disease/trait, ge...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 353 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. This is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. The static analyzer incorrectly flags Markdown code block backticks as shell commands, genetic research p-value notation (e.g., p=5e-8) as cryptographic algorithms, and the slug 'k-dense' as C2 keywords. The skill documents legitimate API queries to the public NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog maintained by EBI and NHGRI.

content.user_title: Query GWAS Catalog for SNP Trait Associations
content.value_statement: Access comprehensive genome-wide association study data from the NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog. Search variants by rs ID, trait, or gene to retrieve p-values, effect sizes, and summary statistics for genetic research.
actual_capabilities: Query SNP-trait associations from the GWAS Catalog
Search variants by rs ID, disease trait, or gene symbol
Retrieve p-values, effect sizes, and odds ratios
Access summary statistics for genome-wide studies
limitations: API rate limits apply to excessive requests
Full summary statistics not available for all studies
Requires EFO trait identifiers for precise trait queries

use_cases.title: Find disease-associated variants
use_cases.description: Query the GWAS Catalog to identify genetic variants associated with specific diseases or traits for research studies.

use_cases.title: Build polygenic risk scores
use_cases.description: Retrieve significant SNP associations with p-values and effect sizes to develop polygenic risk prediction models.

use_cases.title: Identify drug targets
use_cases.description: Explore genetic associations between variants and traits to identify potential therapeutic targets and biomarkers.

prompt_templates.title: Find variant associations
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all trait associations for the genetic variant rs7903146 including p-values and risk alleles.

prompt_templates.title: Search by disease trait
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all genetic variants associated with type 2 diabetes from the GWAS Catalog with genome-wide significance.

prompt_templates.title: Gene-centric analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: What variants in or near the TCF7L2 gene are associated with any traits in the GWAS Catalog?

prompt_templates.title: Summary statistics access
prompt_templates.prompt: Retrieve the summary statistics for GWAS study GCST001234 including all tested variants and their effect sizes.

output_examples.input: Show me variants associated with body mass index
output: Found 1,847 associations for body mass index (EFO_0004340)
rs1558902 (FTO gene) - p=1.3e-71, effect allele: A
rs1421085 (FTO gene) - p=4.4e-67, effect allele: T
Study sample size: 681,275 individuals across 88 studies

best_practices: Use EFO trait identifiers for precise queries instead of free-text trait names
Implement rate limiting (0.1-0.5 second delays) between API requests
Cite the GWAS Catalog publication when using data in research
anti_patterns: Making rapid consecutive requests without delays (causes rate limiting)
Assuming all associations have the same population applicability
Using p-value thresholds lower than 5e-8 for initial discovery

faq.question: What is the GWAS Catalog?
faq.answer: The NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog is a curated database of published genome-wide association studies containing SNP-trait associations.

faq.question: Do I need an API key?
faq.answer: No. The GWAS Catalog APIs are open access and do not require authentication or API keys.

faq.question: What is genome-wide significance?
faq.answer: Genome-wide significance is p < 5x10-8, the standard threshold for GWAS to account for multiple testing.

faq.question: How do I find the EFO ID for a trait?
faq.answer: Search the EBI Ontology Lookup Service or use the GWAS Catalog web interface with the trait name.

faq.question: Can I download full summary statistics?
faq.answer: Yes. Summary statistics are available via FTP download for studies that have deposited data.

faq.question: What populations are represented in the data?
faq.answer: Ancestry information is provided in study metadata. Historically European-biased; newer studies include more diverse populations.
